meta_description: The calendar that listens. Dictate your event and it appears automatically. As simple as saying it out loud.
hero_subtitle: The calendar that listens. Dictate your event and it appears instantly.
hero_example_result: → The event is created. That's it.
hero_microcopy: Free. No card required. Ready in 30 seconds.
problem_title: You deserve better than a form for a simple appointment.
problem_subtitle: We all have better things to do than dig through 47 options.
problem_pain_1_desc: You tell yourself "I should call the doctor" and… you forget. Opening the calendar is too much effort.
problem_pain_2_desc: 15 clicks to add "Coffee with Marie Friday". Seriously, in 2026?
problem_pain_3_desc: Advanced recurrence, multiple time zones, team sharing… You just want to note an appointment, not run a company.
problem_agitation_line1: Google Calendar is fine… if you like forms. Apple Calendar is pretty… if you have time to type. Fantastical is powerful… at €7/month for features you’ll never use.
problem_agitation_line2: The result? You end up writing appointments on a sticky note. Or worse, you forget. Again.
solution_title: A calendar that understands when you speak.
solution_subtitle: SayCal is the calendar you’ll actually use. Not because it does everything, but because it does the essential perfectly: create an event in less time than it takes to say it.
solution_highlight_prefix: One mic button. One sentence. The event appears.
solution_benefit_1_desc: "Dentist tomorrow 9am" → AI understands, extracts date, time, title. The event appears on your calendar. You don’t type, you don’t select.
solution_benefit_2_desc: No endless sidebar, no options hidden in submenus. Just your schedule, readable at a glance. The premium design you deserve without the premium price.
solution_benefit_3_desc: Responsive web app, installable like a native app. Whether you’re on your iPhone on the subway or your Mac at work, the experience stays smooth.
solution_benefit_4_desc: The code is open. You can audit it, fork it, self-host it. No hidden tracking, no dark patterns. We make money because you find the product useful, not by selling your data.
features_item_1_title: Speak naturally, we handle the rest
features_item_1_desc: Say "Meeting with Julie next Monday from 10 to 11:30" or simply "Dentist tomorrow morning." The AI understands the context, extracts the information, and creates the event automatically.
features_item_2_title: Day, week, or month — your choice
features_item_2_desc: Move easily between views. Intuitive color coding so you can spot your events at a glance. The interface adapts to how you plan.
features_item_3_title: One click on a slot = a new event
features_item_3_desc: For those who prefer typing, a minimal form: title, time, color. 3 fields, not 15. Click, fill, done.
features_item_4_title: Install the app without the App Store
features_item_4_desc: Add SayCal to your home screen in one tap. Icon, notifications, native feel. No 200MB download or intrusive auto-updates.
testimonials_subtitle: Built for people who forget everything (we do too).
testimonial_1_quote: I finally have a calendar I actually open. Saying “Call mom Sunday” and seeing the event appear is magic.
testimonial_2_quote: I switched from Notion Calendar to SayCal. Simpler, faster, and I can see the code. It’s exactly what I was looking for.
testimonial_3_quote: On the subway, I speak my week’s appointments and it’s done. I don’t even touch my phone at the office for that anymore.
pricing_title: Simple pricing for a simple product.
pricing_subtitle: Cheaper than a coffee per month. More useful too.
pricing_tier_free_description: Everyone — try it with no commitment
pricing_tier_premium_description: For people who want to create events by speaking
pricing_guarantee_body: Not convinced by Premium? We’ll refund you, no questions asked. One email is enough.
faq_subtitle: Everything you want to know about SayCal
faq_1_answer: No, SayCal requires an internet connection to sync your events and for voice recognition. It’s a web app designed to stay up to date.
faq_2_question: Can I sync with Google Calendar or Apple Calendar?
faq_2_answer: Not yet. Two-way sync is planned post-MVP. For now, SayCal is an independent calendar.
faq_3_question: Does voice creation work in any language?
faq_3_answer: Yes! Our AI understands any language. Speak in French, English, Spanish, German, or any other language — it will analyze and create the event automatically.
faq_4_question: How many voice events can I create per month?
faq_4_answer: With Premium (€5/month), voice creation is unlimited.
faq_5_answer: Your events are stored in a PostgreSQL database hosted in Europe (Frankfurt). Encrypted connection, no third-party access, no resale. The code is open-source so you can verify it yourself.
faq_6_answer: Yes! The code is available on GitHub. You can deploy your own instance with your own API keys (Deepgram + Gemini). Documentation included.
faq_7_question: How do I cancel my subscription?
faq_7_answer: One click in settings, or via the Stripe portal. No commitment period, no hidden fees, no “call customer support”.
faq_8_question: What if I just want the calendar without voice?
faq_8_answer: The free tier is for you. Full calendar, premium interface, unlimited events. Voice is a bonus, not a requirement.
cta_title: Ready to stop fighting your calendar?

cta_body_secondary: No endless forms, no tutorial, no “advanced features” to discover. Just a calendar that works.
cta_note: Free forever. Premium at €5/month if you want voice.
